Valentine's new film delivers heat, upsets baseball world

Red Sox manager Bobby Valentine has produced a new documentary about baseball in the Dominican Republic, and that film is now the subject of controversy, with Major League Baseball voicing its displeasure. (Globe)

Cape kayaker may not have been chased by great white

Walter Szulc Jr. may have been chased by a plankton-eating basking shark, rather than a great white, a state expert said. (Globe, 11:09 a.m.)

Ashland man to plead guilty to terror plot

Rezwan Ferdaus will admit he plotted to crash remote-controlled planes into the Pentagon and the US Capitol, according to a plea agreement. (Boston Globe, 12:15 p.m.)
